headline.main: CANADA.; The Falls of the St. Mauries.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: In the search after novelty, which animates the pedestrian in this traveling age, I intend marking out a route, which he can pursue with advantage, particularly if he be a lover of the picturesque or what is beautiful in Nature.

headline.main: THE FOURTH.; Readings and Records for Fourth July.

docs.lead_paragraph: Seventy or eighty years ago, public meetings and conventions were rare in this country, although they are the order of the day now. The Colonies were ripe for revolt, but there was no organization, and no united expression of public sentiment. There were not wanting distinguished men in the country to take the lead, nor was the fire of liberty unenkindled in the heart of the nation.

docs.lead_paragraph: Doctor CHAPMAN, (says the Philadelphia North American, of Friday,) an eminent physician and excellent man, died at his residence in Philadelphia, yesterday afternoon, at 6 o'clock. He had reached an advanced age, and for the last few years was rapidly declining in health. A native of Vir-.

headline.main: WILLIAMSBURG CITY.; FURTHER PARTICULARS OF THE GREAT STORM DEATH OF A MINISTER. DIVIDEND.

docs.lead_paragraph: Church and Missionary Intelligence. The Houston-street Presbyterian Church of this City, have presented their late pastor, Rev. R. S. STORRS DICKINSON, (now of the First Pres byterian church of Philadelphia) six handsome pieces of silver, as a testimonial of their continued regard.

headline.main: INDIANA.; Sketches of Travel in the Western Country.

docs.lead_paragraph: From Indianapolis, I started for Evansville on Wednesday last, at 11 3/4 o'clock, A. M. Instead of the direct railroad route, which would have brought me to Louisville, or New-Albany, the samn night, I went by way of Madison, at which city arrived about 4 o'clock.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; THIRD-AVENUE RAILROAD. THE NEW CHARTER. ROBBERY OF COIN. MARINE COURT. SUPREME COURTCIRCUIT U. S. COMMISSIONER'S COURT SUPREME COURT CHAMBERS COURT OF COMMON PLEAS. COURT CALENDAR

docs.lead_paragraph: Two specimen cars for the Third-avenue Railroad have been put on the track near the City Hall, for inspection. They are very hand-somely made, and are mounted on elastic springs, of India rabbe. There will be fifty cars altogether, but not more than fifteen or twenty have yet been received. The cars are lettered "Park-row, Bowery, Third-avenue and Sixty-first-street."

docs.lead_paragraph: The great commercial and political revolutions anticipated as a result of the Chinese Rebellion, do not absorb, entirely, the attention of the good folks at Washington.
